net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Class TreeNodeTreeModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.AbstractTreeModel
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.TreeNodeTreeModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreeModel

    public class TreeNodeTreeModel
extends AbstractTreeModel
    A simple tree data model that uses TreeNodes.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Field Detail

      • asksAllowsChildren

        protected boolean asksAllowsChildren
        Determines how the isLeaf method figures out if a node is a leaf node.

      • root

        protected TreeNode root
        Root of the tree.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeNodeTreeModel

        public TreeNodeTreeModel(TreeNode root)
        Creates a tree in which any node can have children.
        Parameters:
        root - The root of the tree model.

      • TreeNodeTreeModel

        public TreeNodeTreeModel(TreeNode root,
                 boolean asksAllowsChildren)
        Creates a tree specifying whether any node can have children, or whether only certain nodes can have children.
        Parameters:
        root - The root of the tree model.
        asksAllowsChildren - Determines if TreeNode objects are asked if they are allowed children (true), or only provide expand ability if a node has children (false).

    • Method Detail

      • asksAllowsChildren

        public boolean asksAllowsChildren()
        Tells how leaf nodes are determined.
        Returns:
        true if a leaf node is determined by calling the getAllowsChildren(), false if determined by checking the child count.

      • getChild

        public Object getChild(Object parent,
              int index)
        Description copied from interface: TreeModel
        Returns the child of parent at index index in the parent's child array. The parent object will either by the object returned by the root node or from a previous call to the getChild() method.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object.
        index - The index of the child.
        Returns:
        The child object.

      • getChildCount

        public int getChildCount(Object parent)
        Description copied from interface: TreeModel
        Returns the number of children of parent. The parent object will either by the object returned by the root node or from a previous call to the getChild() method.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object.
        Returns:
        The number of children at this node.

      • getIndexOfChild

        public int getIndexOfChild(Object parent,
                  Object child)
        Description copied from interface: TreeModel
        Returns the index of child in parent. The parent and child objects will either by the object returned by the root node or from a previous call to the getChild() method.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object.
        child - The child object.
        Returns:
        The index of the child in the parent.

      • getNodeId

        public String getNodeId(Object node)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTreeModel
        Returns null.

        Get an unique ID for the node. This ID will be used in some mediums to find the node in the case where the model and user interface become inconsistent.

        This method may return null if not supported.

        Specified by:
        getNodeId in interface TreeModel
        Overrides:
        getNodeId in class AbstractTreeModel
        Parameters:
        node - The tree node.
        Returns:
        String or null if no ID is available.

      • getPathToRoot

        public TreeNode[] getPathToRoot(TreeNode aNode)
        Builds the parents of node up to and including the root node, where the original node is the last element in the returned array.
        Parameters:
        aNode - The last node in the resulting path.
        Returns:
        TreeNode[] with the root node at index zero and aNode as the last element.

      • getPathToRoot

        protected TreeNode[] getPathToRoot(TreeNode aNode,
                       int depth)
        Builds the parents of node up to and including the root node, where the original node is the last element in the returned array.
        Parameters:
        aNode - The last node in the resulting path.
        depth - The maximum depth of the path.
        Returns:
        TreeNode[] with the root node at index zero and aNode as the last element.

      • getRoot

        public Object getRoot()
        Description copied from interface: TreeModel
        Returns the root of the tree.
        Returns:
        The root.

      • insertNodeInto

        public void insertNodeInto(MutableTreeNode newChild,
                  MutableTreeNode parent,
                  int index)
        Invoked this to insert newChild at location index in parents children.
        Parameters:
        newChild - The new child node.
        parent - The parent of the new child node.
        index - The index of the child in the parent.

      • isLeaf

        public boolean isLeaf(Object node)
        Description copied from interface: TreeModel
        Returns true if node is a leaf. If this method returns true then it is assumed this node cannot have children. No calls to getChildCount() or getChild() will be made. In most medium implementations, nodes that return true will not have an expand/collapse control, nodes that return false may always have an expand collapse control, but may have no child nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - The object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the node cannot have children.

      • nodeChanged

        public void nodeChanged(TreeNode node)
        Invoke this method after you've changed how node is to be represented in the tree.
        Parameters:
        node - The node that has changed.

      • nodesChanged

        public void nodesChanged(TreeNode node,
                int[] childIndices)
        Invoke this method after you've changed how the children identified by childIndicies are to be represented in the tree.
        Parameters:
        node - The parent node.
        childIndices - The indicies of the child nodes that have changed.

      • nodeStructureChanged

        public void nodeStructureChanged(TreeNode node)
        Invoke this method if you've totally changed the children of node and its childrens children, etc.
        Parameters:
        node - The parent node.

      • nodesWereInserted

        public void nodesWereInserted(TreeNode node,
                     int[] childIndices)
        Invoke this method after you've inserted some TreeNodes into node.
        Parameters:
        node - The parent node.
        childIndices - The indicies of the child nodes that have been inserted.

      • nodesWereRemoved

                    int[] childIndices,
                    Object[] removedChildren)
        Invoke this method after you've removed some TreeNodes from node.
        Parameters:
        node - The parent node.
        childIndices - The indicies of the child nodes that have been removed.
        removedChildren - The child nodes that have been removed.

        Parameters:
        node - The node to remove.

      • setAsksAllowsChildren

        public void setAsksAllowsChildren(boolean newValue)
        Sets whether or not to test leafness by asking getAllowsChildren() or isLeaf() to the TreeNodes.
        Parameters:
        newValue - true to use getAllowsChildren() to determine if a node is a leaf.

      • setRoot

        public void setRoot(TreeNode root)
        Sets a new root.
        Parameters:
        root - The new root.

      • valueForPathChanged

        public void valueForPathChanged(TreePath path,
                       Object newValue)
        This sets the user object of the TreeNode identified by path and posts a node changed. Messaged when the user has altered the value for the item identified by path to newValue.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the node that has changes.
        newValue - The new value for the node.
